modules.description: This module defines constants and conversion functions for four-byte identifiers used to access OpenType font tables, enabling operations like table lookup and data decoding. It works with string, integer, and formatted representations of these identifiers to facilitate comparisons and manipulations during font processing. Typical use cases include accessing specific font tables (e.g., glyph outlines, kerning pairs) and converting between human-readable and binary tag formats for debugging or serialization.

This module decodes OpenType fonts in memory, offering direct access to font tables, glyph mappings, and metadata extraction with detailed error handling for malformed data. It supports operations like querying Unicode coverage, retrieving glyph metrics, and inspecting font features through both direct APIs and helper submodules. The submodule provides utilities for working with four-byte font tags, enabling seamless conversion between string, integer, and binary representations for table identification and lookup. Example uses include extracting kerning information, validating font structure, and inspecting glyph outlines for rendering or analysis.
